column4: Medibuntu's repository is deactivated by upgrading to a newer Ubuntu release, so you should run this command again after the release upgrade.
why in the name of pete doesn't Ubuntu give you a flopping heads-up when it deactivates a bunch of codecs??
it already broke my touchpad on update...
I feel sometimes like the Ubuntu core team dgaf about the average user's experience
yeah, me too...but it's not like they get paid. I mean they are building to fit the average user
fair enough on the first point, don't see eye to eye on the second
I can't use the newer versions because I have a specific setup for recording studio equipment
but if I were using a generic laptop without all sorts of specific configs, it usually works fine for me
you can always freeze your version, so as not to update except for security
that should save most of your old codecs, provided you dodge the dist-upgrade
oh yeah, I understand...right now I am staring at an inoperable shell
